page.title: 06The Beach in July
page.content: Yesterday we went to the beach at Jackson's Corner.We were asking people questions about what they thought of Ingoldmells and where they came from. Jackson's Corner is near the Lookout with a restaurant.Towards Skegness on the sands was an icecream van and a man selling things to eat.For about 60 metres the sand is soft where lots of people sit in the sun.A bit further down is a bank and wet sand where no-one is sun bathing.The sea defences are strong.The steps stop some of the waves in rough seas and the concrete walls are curved and throw the waves back.The breakwaters stop all the sand from washing away and leaving clay and stones.When we were walking along the beach most of the children were playing with balls and kites or digging in the sand in front of the dunes.
